keyPoints.point: 0 is not allowed in the denominator
You can't take the square root of a negative number

definitions.definition: The domain of a function is the set of all inputs for which the function is defined.
The range of a function is the set of all possible ouputs.

keyPoints.point: a limit of the form 1/0 is called a limit that does not exist.
always remember that lim x->3 (x-1)=2. Informally, plug in the limiting value of x when it is permitted.

keyPoints.definition: The notation lim x->a f(x) is denoting the value f(x) approaches as xâ€”>a
always remember that lim x->2 (x+3)(x-2)/(x-2)=5. That is, common terms in the numerator and denominator can be eliminated in the limit.

preReqMaterial.preReq: This question assumes you know how to factor; e.g. x^2+4x+3=(x+1)(x+3)

keyPoints.point: When a square root appears on the numerator
if the left hand limit does not equal the right hand limit, the limit does not exist

definitions.definition: A left hand limit is the value the function approaches from left to right, as in the figure --
